alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 2:36PM MST until July 30 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Slate Creek basin in... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 235 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Slate Creek basin. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Slate Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Slate Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila County This includes the following highways... State Route 188 near mile marker 268. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Slate Creek basin. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
